meanings.definition: To have a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage in the bin began to reek after sitting in the sun all day.
meanings.sent2: The old socks in the laundry basket started to reek after being forgotten for weeks.
meanings.sent3: The stinky cheese made the whole kitchen reek, causing everyone to hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The foul odor from the sewer grate seemed to reek of decay and filth.
meanings.sent5: The skunk's spray made the entire yard reek, lingering for hours.

meanings.sent1: The reek of rotten eggs filled the kitchen after the gas leak.
meanings.sent2: The musty reek of the old basement made it unpleasant to spend time there.
meanings.sent3: The reek of burnt popcorn wafted through the office, causing everyone to cough.
meanings.sent4: The reek of cigarette smoke clung to his clothes long after he had quit smoking.
meanings.sent5: The reek of wet dog permeated the living room after the pup's bath.

meanings.definition: To give off a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The pile of dirty laundry began to reek in the hot summer sun.
meanings.sent2: The dumpster behind the restaurant started to reek as the week-old food decomposed.
meanings.sent3: The skunk sprayed, causing the whole area to reek of its distinctive odor.
meanings.sent4: The spoiled milk left in the fridge began to reek, making it clear it was time to clean.
meanings.sent5: The stagnant water in the pond began to reek, signaling a need for maintenance.
